title: Japan's PM Sanae Takaichi set to win big in snap legislative elections
subhead: Polls show the Liberal Democratic Party (PLD) of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on course for a decisive victory in the February 8 legislative elections.

title: Epstein scandal prompts Jack Lang to offer resignation as head of the World Arab Institute
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
Bruno Retailleau, a hardline conservative ready to run for French president
subhead: While he has claimed not to have the presidential election 'virus,' the leader of Les Républicains has been working on a candidacy for the 2027 election. The only questions left are how and when to announce his bid.

title: Spain and Portugal brace for more floods
subhead: Days after floods caused by Storm Leonardo proved deadly across the Iberian Peninsula, Storm Mara has prompted the deployment of more than 26,500 rescuers.

title: French foreign trade undergoes a surprising rebound in spite of Trump's trade war
subhead: Thanks to a larger increase in exports than in imports, France's trade deficit narrowed, dropping from €79.1 billion in 2024 to €69.2 billion in 2025.

title: 'Heated Rivalry': Star-crossed love between two ice hockey players
subhead: The series, which has enjoyed massive success in Canada, brings a gay romance to the traditionally masculine world of ice hockey.

Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhead: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

title: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhead: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: Richard Reeves, the researcher studying the suffering of the modern man
subhead: Keen to combat the exploitation of male discontent by the far right, Reeves, who founded the American Institute for Boys and Men think tank, wrote a book that explains the appeal of this political current to men.
